result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew R. Mayotte

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on February 14, 2023 at 11:30 am.

1:45 PM Defendant Matthew R. Mayotte in court.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. Public defender's office is still looking for an attorney to represent the defendant.  Mr. Mayotte stated that he is waiving his right to an attorney and waiving his preliminary hearing.   Defendant indicated that he will be going into a treatment program.  Court finds that she will wait until after January for Mr. Mayotte to make a decision regarding his right to an attorney and waiving his preliminary hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for February 14, 2023 at 11:30 am.

10:48 AM Defendant Matthew R. Mayotte in court.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. Attorney Mayotte indicated that he does qualify for a public defender. An attorney has not be appointed.  This is scheduled for a preliminary hearing.  Matthew Mayotte is requesting an adjournment of the preliminary hearing. Matthew is waiving the time limits for a preliminary hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

1:29 PM Defendant Matthew R. Mayotte in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. Court advised DE of charges and penalties; advised of right to attorney.  Defendant is requesting a timely preliminary hearing.  Defendant is waiving the extra two days beyond the preliminary hearing date.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 8, 2022 at 10:45 am.

3:00 pm - Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matthew Mayotte appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header. Victim notification has been complied. Attorney Tlusty is requesting a $500.00 signature bond; booking; no contact with J.J.M. - dob:  5-27-1980.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 1:30 pm.  - rt
